Key Match Events: Fakhar Zaman smashed an unbeaten 126 in 81 balls to keep Pakistan up with the DLS asking rate
Kane Williamson scored 113 runs off 63 balls
Pre-Game Insights: New Zealand's fate not in their hands anymore
Australia and Afghanistan can still win the tournament
Pakistan's best-case scenario is to win against England and hope Sri Lanka beats New Zealand
If Afghanistan wins both their remaining games, they will go to 12 points
Even if Afghanistan wins one of their remaining games, they will go to 10 points
The match was affected by rain, leading to a reduced number of overs
Post-Match Reflections: Pakistan won by 21 runs using the DLS method
Fakhar Zaman's unbeaten 126 kept Pakistan in the game
The match was a crucial one for both teams in the tournament
Miscellaneous Highlights: Rain interrupted play, reducing the game to 20 overs per side
New Zealand's highest World Cup total was 401
